text: Erigeron nematophyllus is a North American species of flowering plant in the daisy family known by the common name Needle-leaf fleabane. It native to the western part of the United States, in Utah, Colorado, and Wyoming.Biota of North America Program 2014 county distribution map Erigeron nematophyllus is a small perennial herb rarely more than 18 centimeters (7.2 inches) tall, producing a taproot. The leaves are very narrow and thread-like or needle- like. The plant generally produces only 1-3 flower head per stem, each head with up to 55 white or pink ray florets surrounding numerous yellow disc florets. The species grows on sandy or rocky soil in sagebrush flats or conifer woodlands.Flora of North America, Erigeron nematophyllus Rydberg, Bull. Torrey Bot. Club. 32: 124. 1905.
